urls.title: ESMA in brief
urls.description: The European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) is an independent European Union (EU) Authority that contributes to safeguarding the stability of the EU's financial system by enhancing the protection of investors and promoting stable and orderly financial markets.

urls.description: EMIR introduces a harmonised set of organisational, business conduct and prudential requirements for clearing service providers. CCPs interpose themselves between counterparties to a derivative contract, becoming the buyer to every seller and the seller to every buyer. In doing so, CCPs become the focal point for derivative transactions thus increasing market transparency and

#ESMA Chair, #Maijoor: ESMA fostered exchanges among national authorities on the use of liquidity management tools (LMTs). In addition, ESMA has been collecting data on the use of extraordinary LMTs (modest increase) but also the adaptation of LMTs which are commonly used.

#ESMA Exec. Dir. #VerenaRoss: ESMA does not have the mandate to start big investor education initiatives. We see our role as supporting and coordinating the efforts of national authorities. ESMA is considering, together with national supervisors, to further develop this mandate.

#ESMA Exec. Dir. #VerenaRoss: We have noticed an uptake and acceleration of new #investors entering the market in the context of #COVID19. Online services are experiencing a boom and we need to make sure that young investors do not get 'burned'. The key is financial knowledge.

ESMA Exec. Dir. #VerenaRoss: We are seeing a new investor generation. Young & first time investors get their information from t/ internet. This shift poses challenges for regulators.
